--- title: "Improving drug resistance models" format: html: code-fold: true code-summary: "Show the code" description: The models for drug sensitivity could be improved. Here I try a few ways date-format: iso date: 2024-04-03 draft: true categories: - data analysis - gdsc execute: freeze: true --- ::: {#553a1c9b .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pandas as pd import numpy as np import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import lightgbm from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split from sklearn.metrics import mean_absolute_error from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression from re import sub from IPython.display import Markdown ``` ::: ::: {#80614b5f .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Reading the excel was taking ages. The csv import, with extraneous columns removed, is much faster ic50_data = pd.read_csv("data/GDSC1.csv") ic50_data.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=2} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {#096e2f27 .cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} test_counts = ic50_data[['DRUG_NAME', 'COSMIC_ID']] .groupby('DRUG_NAME').agg('count') fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize = (8,6)) ax.hist(test_counts, bins = 50) ax.set_xlabel('Number of cells tested') ax.set_ylabel('Number of drugs') plt.tight_layout() plt.show() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](improving_gdsc_models_files/figure-html/cell-4-output-1.png){width=757 height=564} ::: ::: ::: {#8396a86f .cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} Markdown(f"Of the {len(test_counts)} drugs in the dataset, {int((test_counts >800).sum())} have over 800 tests.") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display .cell-output-markdown execution_count=4} Of the 378 drugs in the dataset, 322 have over 800 tests. ::: ::: ::: {#5850f81c .cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} rma_expr = pd.read_csv("data/Cell_line_RMA_proc_basalExp.txt", sep = "\t") rma_expr.dropna(inplace=True) rma_expr= rma_expr.set_index('GENE_SYMBOLS') rma_expr.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=5} ```{=html}
